chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Operating While Revoked (Cause Great Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Freddie Reynolds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowlingly Operate Motor Vehicle While Revoked-Cause Great Bodily Harm To Another, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to Waukesha County case 20CT1375. Straight time.

Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Mandatory costs, surcharges and assessment including the DNA surcharges.  To be paid by 10/12/2023 or to convert to a civil judgment.
Court waived nonmandatory court costs due to defendant's indigency.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Knowlingly Operate Motor Vehicle While Revoked-Cause Great Bodily Harm To Another

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Freddie Reynolds

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Freddie Reynolds in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Freddie Reynolds.  Attorney Kimberly Dorice Schoepp in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 1:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his/her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored.
*
Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 21 days days in the House of Correction, consecutive to Waukesha County case 20CT1375, straight time. .
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

Court waived non-mandatory court costs due to defendant's indigency.  Mandatory costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by 10/12/2023 to convert to a civil judgment.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
.
Filed:
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
 
Appeal rights given
Telephone call from Attorney Tom Harris to schedule a plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Clerk to notify DA Kim Schoepp.  Defendant is in custody.

Case calendared for a Plea and Sentencing.  
Court in receipt of the State's Motion to Adjourn.
Proposed dates emailed to defense counsel and waiting for response.
Matter adjourned to 10-3-2022 at 8:30am.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: State's Motion to Adjourn 9-30-2022 plea and sentencing hearing.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Freddie Reynolds not in court, in custody.
Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Discovery and an offer has been received.  Defendant would like to resolve the case and request a plea and sentencing. 

Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Freddie Reynolds not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested an additional scheduling conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant Freddie Reynolds in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Freddie Reynolds in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Freddie Reynolds not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Freddie Reynolds in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Freddie Reynolds in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Freddie Reynolds appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
